website_summaries.verdict: If you’ve already tried other constipation remedies with little or no success, this gentle emollient laxative is sure to get things moving along quickly.
pros: Lubricates the intestinal tract and loosens hard stools with fatty acids to assist bowel movements without unpleasant cramping or explosive elimination
Enriched with iron and essential vitamins
Works well even in severe cases
Can be used for both dogs and cats, making it a great option for multi-pet households
cons: A bit pricey, but a little goes a long way

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting for pooch to drop a decent deuce
customer_reviews.text: Slathered the recommended amount on yesterday's dinner. Same amount this morning then off to the park for what I hoped would be a less strenuous dump. No such luck yet. She worked like a rented mule to drop a tiny turd. Will update later. 3 days later and the transformation is complete! From too much work for little return to a much easier, more normal dump. Thanks Lax'aire, your the best!
customer_reviews.author: Frank N. Stein

customer_reviews.title: Senior female GSD with EPI and  IBD +constipation
customer_reviews.text: I have a 12 and a half year old GSD with pancreatic insufficiency and irritable bowel who has been struggling since June with constipation and it is now September. I got the usual try pumpkin, apples, green beans, try olive oil Etc all to no avail and then I got online and discovered this product. It took 3 days but it worked. The box has standard dosing but I can't believe it's one-size-fits-all, especially when I have a 65 pound GSD versus a 10 lb Yorkie, so I put out a ribbon of a very generous 2 and 1/2 inches. I will now use the maintenance dosing so she never has to suffer from constipation again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Swan

customer_reviews.title: Chronically Constipated
customer_reviews.text: I have a dog with chronic constipation. This product has worked wonders for her and made her life a lot more comfortable. When my four-legged family members are happy, I am happy!
customer_reviews.author: Richard Renner

customer_reviews.title: Poop-Producing Wonder Gel
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm. My Frenchie was on codeine for a week following a back injury due to his unfortunate predisposition for intervertebral disk disease (adopt, don't shop) and in almost three days, no poo. Poor little guy was tip-toeing around like he was trying to sneak up on somebody. Next day ordered this and after feeding it to him, it produced a poo within 40 minutes. YES! Imagine my relief at not having to take him BACK to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST...paws down
customer_reviews.text: Your cat has chronic constipation? This will do the trick. Set up a schedule according to directions for ongoing use. My cat is much happier and mischievous again. I'm so sorry she was in discomfort for so long (hard stools) while I tried my way through a million remedies. Lax'aire is the best, paws down.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: it was fine and worked just fine - unfortunately I dont need ...
customer_reviews.text: it was fine and worked just fine - unfortunately I dont need it anymore be careful with this it is very potent
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Worked VERY well.
customer_reviews.text: SUPER HAPPY with this product. The package is correct. You can just put a little in your hand or on your finger and you dog will lick it right off. I used less than the package recommended. I just put a tiny little drop on the end of my finger for my 20 - 25 lb dog, he licked it right off. He has a small bowel movement within an hour and then the next morning, he produced something that proved this product works very well. I couldn't be happier with this item. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was having issues as she is not walking or moving much with severe arthritis. We needed something that would gently help her with her bm’s. This has been great. She takes it without fuss and it has worked well. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jack F. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Hear the angles cry
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea what flavor this is but my pup approves! First day no poops, second day morning oh man! My poor gal is a disgusting freak who loves to eat toe nails and whatnot off the floor, she must have found something because she was constipated! Go outside and yep yep, her tail would bob up and down too. Poor thing, however this saved my life! I tried olive oil, and pumpkin with no luck but this stuff right here worked!
customer_reviews.author: Ana Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Laxatives for cats
customer_reviews.text: This helped my 20 year old Henry with his constipation and hard stools. The best thing is the reasonable price compared to other products in the $40's and 50's. And no vet necessary. Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: lyncat

customer_reviews.title: This is unquestionably THE best pet laxative
customer_reviews.text: This is unquestionably THE best pet laxative, no matter what other products your vet tries to tell you are the same. I especially liked it for a long-haired cat we had (for hairballs), because I could carefully syringe it to her, and she actually seemed to like the taste fairly well, considering she was about as finicky as they come. We tried another that was touted as best; just as good another highly regarded brand; by vets and the nearby university vet school. Nope. This is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Worthington

customer_reviews.title: Works great !
customer_reviews.text: He wasn't crazy about the taste but thanks to one person who wrote a review, I put a little on his nose and he licked it off, then licked rest off my finger. Really liked the product. Didn't cause diarrhea, just softer BMs.
customer_reviews.author: P T Hampton

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: This product is definetly worth the price.I order it and it does work quickly with dog constipation .Within less than a day.I would recommend this product. This is a item that veternarians should recommend but they dont.
customer_reviews.author: shae

customer_reviews.title: It works well although you have to give a pretty good amount over 2-3 days for it to work
customer_reviews.text: This is the only fur ball stuff one of my cats will eat. The other cat will eat all the others I've tried. It works well although you have to give a pretty good amount over 2-3 days for it to work, but the results are worth it. I recommend this product for all long hair cats.
customer_reviews.author: Catz Meow

customer_reviews.title: Unexpected Result
customer_reviews.text: I have a small dog with IVDD and she was going through a bout of constipation and was not really eating very much. I received our tube yesterday and this morning tried just a small bit on my finger which she eagerly ate. She ate every bit of her food. I think the product woke up her appetite. After an hour she also used the bathroom, just a little but it was something.
customer_reviews.author: M. Carter

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves It.
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY ointment for hairballs that my Ragdoll likes. He is very fussy and I have wasted so much money buying different brands. Nope.....he just turns up his snotty little nose and walks away! With Lax' aire I just put it on the tip of my finger, call him, and he runs right over and licks it all off. I have been buying this for several years from a vet but he lives about 18 miles from me. I was SO happy to find out Amazon carries it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lingenfelter

customer_reviews.title: great for cat with occasional constipation
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a huge drama queen but really seemed to be experiencing painful constipation. We had to take him to the vet for dehydration and severe constipation twice. So decided to try this per vet recommendation. Unlike other reviews, he doesn't "love it" like a treat and eat it off my hand, but I have put it on his paws to lick off and also now add it to his wet food a few times a week. It does seem to be reducing his constipation overall. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Susan H in Cary NC

customer_reviews.title: Good for elderly animals, helps make bowel movements more gentle.
customer_reviews.text: My cats weren't thrilled with the flavor by itself, but mixed with other soft foods and treats they liked, they ate it up. My elderly cat was having painful bowel movements on occassion, and this has really helped her strain less. She's even behaved noticeably better since using it. I like that its safe for both cats to eat also, and helps both with hairballs. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody7549

customer_reviews.title: SO glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my poor little constipated chi mix. He had practically no appetite and was struggling to poop for a while! After using this for a few days, he was able to have a good bowel movement with no struggling. I use it about three times a week to keep things moving, and so far it has worked great. He is even eating all of his food now!! I would recommend this. He also loves the flavor and licks it right off my finger.
customer_reviews.author: DinaD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product!
customer_reviews.text: Worked exactly as promised for my 7 lb chihuahua. He had missed 3 days of bm's. I gave him this product as described on package and in 40 minutes - Voila! You can't ask for more than that! Perfection. Wish humans had something so perfect.
customer_reviews.author: cindy e.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but works. Cat liked flavor, then got bored.
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 11 and became severely constipated requiring a lot of vet visits. Now I put this in his food every day and it definitely helps. Initially, I just put a squeeze on a plate and he licked it off, but then he decided he was bored. So now I have to mix it into his wet food. This has no harmful ingredients and my vet okayed it. I’m going to try another product that is less expensive, but if it doesn’t work as well, I’ll use this again.
customer_reviews.author: gaffy

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be Working
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 18 year old cat who had been having problems with rock hard stools. I've just been giving it to her for 5 days and I can already tell a difference. She doesn't like the taste of it, so she won't just lick it off my finger like some of the other reviews said their cats would, but I just put it on my finger and then wipe it inside her mouth and she doesn't mind it too much. Definitely worth the money in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Hardin

customer_reviews.title: It Works
customer_reviews.text: My dog takes a dose of this everyday as a maintenance for a perineal hernia. He will not take it alone, he doesn’t like the taste. I mix it with peanut butter and he eats it that way. My dog never gets diarrhea with this product. It works more like a stool softener for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Moschara

customer_reviews.title: Recommend highly
customer_reviews.text: Having a dog and cat in the house cat being older the dog hairballs are common. If you’ve never used hairball remedy before it will take 2-3 applications to work. After you should include this in a maintenance schedule of 1-2 times a week to prevent. Works great would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Dawn T.

customer_reviews.title: REALLY works!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried because my cat wasn’t eating much and hadn’t had a bowel movement in two days. I put 1/2 inch on her paw and she licked it right off. She had a normal/slightly softer bowel movement the next day and was back to eating and feeling better! Works like a miracle. I highly recommend trying and even just keeping on hand for situations like this!
customer_reviews.author: Madison O'Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Saved me a trip to the vet!
customer_reviews.text: My cat got very constipated. Ew, I know. She's a picky eater, and I fully expected her to turn up her nose at this stuff, too. Maple flavored? She would not be impressed. Nothing ventured, nothing gained. She LOVES it. Got things moving, and she's back to herself! I will keep using this for maintenance so we don't ever get so backed up again!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Anschuetz

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: My kitty has no idea she's eating this when mixed with her food. It definitely helps her and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Cmz

customer_reviews.title: My picky cat eats this - no problem!
customer_reviews.text: My cat takes this no problem. She has hairball issues and I was using another brand that she refused. It’s literally easier to give my cat a bath, than to get her to take the other brand. Even mixing in food, The other brand: she’d refuse This brand she doesn’t hesitate to eat and it helps with her hair balls a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Bb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: My large breed was a little stopped up, not full on constipated, but still could tell he was having discomfort. This was perfect. He did not too loose by taking this, just made it easier to poop. I detest Big Pharma but this product works.
customer_reviews.author: Tribulation ExodusTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Approved!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this! Our vet suggested we give her some twice a week. She eats it off the plate!
customer_reviews.author: mom and teacher

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended by veterinarians
customer_reviews.text: My male pug is showing symptoms of constipation I bought this because I couldn’t find it at the local pet store is highly recommended by veterinarians and I feel like it is already began to help him
customer_reviews.author: Estella O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: The only one the cat likes
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work as a laxative and the cat loves it. He begs for it every night (we only give it to him every other night).
customer_reviews.author: RxDr

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my cat
customer_reviews.text: My cat had very bad constipation and this product, along with a probiotic supplement helped so much better than the expensive medication she was on. The medication didn't help at all and we tried a few different options before finding this simpler and less toxic option (than the chemicals in the medications).
customer_reviews.author: Chris V

customer_reviews.title: Very effective product
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for our dog after leg surgery, and it worked like a CHARM! She shied away from it the first time I offered it, since we'd tried several different (sometimes yucky tasting) remedies before. Just follow the directions for a taste-test, and your dog will eat it willingly. Only needed one dose to get her body working regularly again.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Martin

customer_reviews.title: Really works on Fur Ball gagging
customer_reviews.text: My dog was licking her fur a lot. She started gagging a lot like she had something stuck in her throat - she couldn't barely breathe at times. I gave her this and after 2 days she was all better. It's amazing and it works.
customer_reviews.author: sgmabmpgm

customer_reviews.title: Got Results
customer_reviews.text: Review asked me to rate the taste. Lol. I didn’t try it but my dog didn’t seem to mind it added to her food. Got results. Pup feels much better.
customer_reviews.author: SueG

customer_reviews.title: They think it’s a treat!
customer_reviews.text: This is SO easy to eliminate dreaded hair balls. I’ve used various brands over the years, the last two of which received a “meh” reaction from the cats. Not this one...they think it’s a treat and I’m so happy it solves the hair ball problem.
customer_reviews.author: Watch Fan

customer_reviews.title: This works awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a knee surgery a week ago and it is taking pain meds that's causing constipation. She had 3 days without pooping and 30 - 40 min after giving her Laxaire she did it! I was very worried for her bc I can't stop giving her the pain meds. So this laxative works awesome. More info: My dog is German Shepperd, 2.5 y.o and I gave her 2 inches of the paste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor, recommended by my vet.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love the taste of this so it's easy to get them to eat. It's difficult to tell how well it works, because I'm not consistent enough in giving it to them. But I do believe they are less constipated when they get it regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: It really works!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh man this thing really works... my dog was constipated for 3 days I felt so bad for him. He didn't want to eat or play. I took him to the vet and they gave him antibiotics. He still didn't go poop. I got this and gave it to him right away. The next day he popped. He loves it that was a plus!
customer_reviews.author: Eri R

customer_reviews.title: It has worked for us for years
customer_reviews.text: Sorry I can't rate the taste on this. 🤣😉 My cats seem to be perfectly fine with it and I don't have to fight them to take it. We have been using this product for years for a few of our cats and it always helps.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: WORKS LIKE ADVERTISED!
customer_reviews.text: I go by the instructions and mix into my cats food. Since I started using this product, my cats have had no problems doing their duty. Now I purchase on a regular basis. Saved me a trip to the Vet.
customer_reviews.author: happykono

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't come with any sort of seal!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't come with any sort of seal so there is no way of knowing if it is tampered with! I tried ordering a few and all of them unsealed. I don't trust giving my cats something like that!
customer_reviews.author: eirefire22

customer_reviews.title: My Burmese cat suffers from a severe hairball affliction every ...
customer_reviews.text: My Burmese cat suffers from a severe hairball affliction every spring no matter how much I brush him. This laxative is the only one I've found to give him relief from it. It may be a little pricey but it gives me relief from constantly cleaning up the mess on floors, carpets, his cat bed, my bed, and my furniture. I'll pay the extra money any day.

customer_reviews.title: Greased Lightning
customer_reviews.text: My best buddy Romeo was suffering from constipation and this fixed him right up. Highly recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Jury is still out.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product because of a couple of reviews I read that it worked...one said it worked within 40 minutes...have been giving the directed amount to o our 10lb dog everyday this week...it’s Friday and she hasn’t pooped since last Sunday...not sure I would waste my money on this product. I gave her more tonight, so if something happens tonight...I’ll post more tomorrow
customer_reviews.author: hotflash1

customer_reviews.title: Cat, 3 day
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my cat whom was struggling to use restroom. Upon reading reviews I was hoping it would work for him 40mins after, like it did for others. It worked on the 3rd day

customer_reviews.title: Pricey for amount for results
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this but it is a bit pricey. Takes more then the recommend amount for my small dog.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaving and money saver
customer_reviews.text: My one kitty has constipation and the other has hairballs. This gel worked amazing! They loved it and licked it right off the end of the tube. Saved my one cat from having to have surgery!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. One readily takes this and the other will only sporadically will take it. It does help with both fur balls and hard stools so five stars for being palatable and being effective.
customer_reviews.author: J.M.

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 1 1/2 year old cat started coughing up hairballs in the transition from kitten fur to adult fur and the change from winter coat to summer. Lax Aire was recommended by my Vet and the problem stopped immediately. The price on my first tube from my Vet was about $5.00 higher than Amazon's price. I'll keep buying from Amazon. The stuff is pricey but cheaper than carpet cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: Ron B

customer_reviews.title: Tummy relief
customer_reviews.text: My chihuahua gets constipation often because he is such a picky eater and doesn't drink much water. I used to get the Lax'aire (a pet laxative) at our local vet clinic to help relieve his tummy trouble. He likes the flavor and it works reasonably fast over a period of 6-12 hours. Lax'aire was a lot more expensive at the vet's office so I am glad it can be ordered off of Amazon now at a cheaper price.
customer_reviews.author: boonDock

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my cat that has anal gland cancer. Because of the tumor she can’t go to the bathroom unless the stool is very soft. It works beautifully! I mix it in her soft food and it must taste good because she eats it. She’s now able to have bowel movements. I believe this has made her more comfortable and extended her life at least a little. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: adenia robbins

customer_reviews.title: Worked quickly
customer_reviews.text: This is just what my 16 yr baby needed, works great. He is a very picky eater and loves the taste. Took a couple of days to work, he is now back to normal. Would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ali

customer_reviews.title: Best hairball product cats love the taste.
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love the taste and it works better than any hairball product around. Our vet sells it also but I prefer to purchase it on Amazon.

customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works. Just a little bit really got my labs system moving. Don't use too much or too often, can cause dehydration or very runny stool

customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this hair ball controller. And I love not having to clean up hair ball vomit! My Bonnie would eat the whole tube at once if I let her!

customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this in the past and it was time to use the product again. My 13 year old male loves the taste and helps with easing out those hair balls.

customer_reviews.title: Effective product!
customer_reviews.text: My dog liked the taste of this as he did not reject it. I just mixed it in with his food. It did the job!

customer_reviews.text: Takes care of constipation that my sweet little poodle was suffering from.

customer_reviews.text: This product does wonders for pets that are aging and have digestive problems with food. Try it and watch your pet's demeanor through walking, etc. It really works!
customer_reviews.author: pch

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for cats that have frequent hairballs
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for cats that have frequent hairballs. When my kitty is exhibiting hairball symptoms, I squeeze a small dab, maybe a half inch or so, on my finger and she will lick it off. It helps her either pass it or bring it up within a day and then she is back to normal. You can easily do this on a regular basis, say once a week or so, to keep hairballs from forming in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Treat for them, treatment for hairballs
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to for a hairball remedy for cats. Works like a charm and they are happy to get this because of the flavor.
customer_reviews.author: ryan navarro

customer_reviews.title: The cat likes it.
customer_reviews.text: It works well and is easy to administer. The cat will lick it off my finger.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yum!!!
customer_reviews.text: Lax'aire is the best tasting treat that my cat has found :-). He comes running every third day! My other cat and the dog line up for a teeny taste too even though they don't need the product. A vet years ago prescribed it and I have used it ever since. It is a bit more pricey and I have to order online but it is well worth the price! Oh yes...and it works too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pam N

customer_reviews.title: A Life-Saver
customer_reviews.text: My 18-year old kitty has had trouble with constipation for several years. She had used some of her nine lives due to the severity of her problem and has had to be hospitalized a couple of times for this. Lax'aire has made her life so much better. She has to use it twice a day, vet's orders, and she eagerly eats it without having to place some on her paw as I have to do other brands. This has given her a few extra years to rule this household.
customer_reviews.author: Joan C

customer_reviews.title: Cat has brand loyalty
customer_reviews.text: My elderly cat eats this several times a week and it helps her vomit less and poop without meowing loudly. The vet stopped carrying it so I tried another brand but she wouldn't touch it so now we order it on Amazon.

All other brands are filled with chemicals, and my can't won't lick it. the cheaper brands are 1/2 the price, but not healthy at all. I'm hooked, and my cat is 17 years old.

customer_reviews.text: Works wonderful! My doxie is the worst at taking any kind of medication and he act loves it! Idk whats in the taste, but he does not hesitate.

customer_reviews.title: Cat hates it
customer_reviews.text: I can't really tell if it works because my cat won't come near it, he hates it. If I hide a little bit in a small pea-size ball of butter, he sometimes eats it. But it's too small an amount to be of consequence. Not the product's fault, it's my cat that is finicky. Not the first time he turns his nose up at good products.
customer_reviews.author: AvidReader

customer_reviews.title: Lax"aire  is a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Our cat likes this product. She has some renal and eating issues and the LaxAire is a good appetite stimulator as well as helping with digestive issues.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne B

customer_reviews.title: Works, and cat thinks it’s a treat!
customer_reviews.text: It’s so worth it to pay a little more and get something the cat willingly eats. 100% worth it. And it’s working great! We’ve had no hair balls and no empty litter boxes since adding this to the routine. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Brought quick relief to my dear old GSD; happy to find such an effective, easty to administer product.
customer_reviews.author: Mysterian

customer_reviews.title: Cat likes it
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with chronic constipation problem. This helps, and he readily licks it off my finger.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Omar

customer_reviews.title: ... but now carries another which my cats do not like. this is a winner
customer_reviews.text: my veterinarian use to carry this product for years but now carries another which my cats do not like. this is a winner. both cats love this product. when asked why they don't carry this anymore, they said they couldn't get it ???. thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: janice hatch

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me... Only used it twice. Had to take my dog to the vet ...
customer_reviews.author: IINDIGO

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have a long-haired indoor cat, who is fastidious in her grooming and hates being brushed. So hairballs are an unfortunate fact of life on a fairly regular basis. I have tried other preparations with her, and she much prefers Lax'aire--its consistency is lighter than Laxatone, and it apparently has a much better flavor: she actually seems to look forward to the dose she gets three or four times a week. And it works! I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Was using the Zoetis product which they no longer make. Switched to this and although only using it a few times, seems to be just as good.
customer_reviews.author: Paula T

customer_reviews.title: Safe and cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you so much! This helped my kitty when she had an impacted furball in her stomach. Will order again !
customer_reviews.author: Rowen Dovani

customer_reviews.title: helps digestion
customer_reviews.text: my cat loves it and eats it right from the dish
customer_reviews.author: John Novak

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my cats vet for her hair balls. Works great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: LGH

customer_reviews.title: Kitties Lap This Up!
customer_reviews.text: This is a carpet saver for us! This is the only hair ball remedy our two cats will eat and they love this stuff. We give it to them on a regular basis and it keeps the hair balls from developing in their intestines and then on to our floors. It's also been a big help to one of cats who is struggling with constipation now that she's an old lady.
customer_reviews.author: W. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Finally I found one that works
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on Laxitone or others that are hard to give or don't work. This is the one ! Just put it on their food, they eat it willingly. They love it and it does the job . What more could you ask for.
customer_reviews.author: Fair and Honest

customer_reviews.title: This product works!
customer_reviews.text: This medication really helps my cat stay regular. I put it on his front paws and he licks it off so it is easy to give.
customer_reviews.author: cutitloose

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.text: My 19 year old cat immediately liked the taste and the product worked overnight. Highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Aniko H.

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't like it.
customer_reviews.text: Other reviews stated cats loved it. Mine didn't.waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Maribeth

customer_reviews.title: not for our picky cat
customer_reviews.text: our cat wouldn't touch her food whenever we added this. although there was no noticeable odor to the laxaire our one cat would always know it was in her food without even eating it.
customer_reviews.author: La Reina

product_meta.title: Lax'aire - 3oz.
product_meta.description: Lax'aire is a gentle emollient laxative and intestinal lubricant with essential vitamins, fatty acids, and iron for your pet's health. It helps with various digestive issues, including hairballs and constipation. Liquid petrolatum is a lubricant and cod liver oil is a laxative. When digested, these ingredients help to relieve discomfort and irritation caused by hairballs and constipation.
